summary: Completed comprehensive testing of modularized WhatsApp Scheduler codebase. Backend successfully refactored from 1967 lines to ~80 lines with modular structure (core/, models/, routes/, services/, utils/). All API endpoints working correctly and frontend-backend integration is fully functional.

compilation_fixes.fix_applied: Updated to use 'apiClient' with proper API paths

passed_tests: Backend API health endpoint /api/ returns running status (200 OK)
Backend API health check /api/health returns healthy status
Backend contacts endpoint /api/contacts returns empty list (200 OK)
Backend templates endpoint /api/templates returns empty list (200 OK)
Backend schedules endpoint /api/schedules returns empty list (200 OK)
Backend settings endpoint /api/settings returns settings object (200 OK)
Backend version endpoint /api/version returns version info (v1.7.0)
Backend WhatsApp status endpoint /api/whatsapp/status returns status
Backend updates endpoints /api/updates/* all working correctly
Frontend loads successfully at localhost:3000
Frontend Dashboard page renders with stats cards
Frontend navigation/sidebar is visible and functional
Frontend Contacts page loads and displays correctly
Frontend Templates page loads and displays correctly
Frontend Scheduler page loads and displays correctly
Frontend Settings page loads with Telegram and Timezone sections
Frontend Connect page loads for WhatsApp connection
Frontend Diagnostics page loads with service status and logs
Frontend sidebar toggle functionality works correctly
Frontend-backend API integration working for all endpoints
All navigation between pages works smoothly
No console errors or compilation errors detected
WhatsApp status indicator shows correct disconnected state
Version information displays correctly in application
